# selectedTextRange

**Instance Property**

The range of selected text in a document.

## Declaration

```swift
@NSCopying @MainActor var selectedTextRange: UITextRange? { get set }
```

## Discussion

If the text range has a length, it indicates the currently selected text. If it has zero length, it indicates the caret (insertion point). If the text-range object is `nil`, it indicates that there is no current selection.

## Related Documentation

- **isEmpty**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the range of text represented by the receiver is zero-length.

## Working with marked and selected text

- **markedTextRange**: The range of currently marked text in a document.
- **markedTextStyle**: A dictionary of attributes that describes how to draw marked text.
- **setMarkedText(_:selectedRange:)**: Inserts the provided text and marks it to indicate that it is part of an active input session.
- **setAttributedMarkedText(_:selectedRange:)**: Inserts the provided styled text and marks it to indicate that it is part of an active input session.
- **unmarkText()**: Unmarks the currently marked text.
- **selectionAffinity**: The desired location for the insertion point.
